So I will send a fire upon Moab,

and Moab shall die amid uproar,

they have rejected the law of the
and have not kept his statutes,
their lies have led them astray,
those after which their fathers walked.
I will send a fire upon Judah,
and it shall devour the strongholds of Jerusalem.
and for four, I will not revoke the punishment,
and the needy for a pair of sandals—
those who trample the head of the poor
into the dust of the earth
turn aside the way of the afflicted;
a man and his father go in to the same girl,
so that my holy name is profaned;
they lay themselves down beside every altar
and in the house of their God they drink
the wine of those who have been fined.
it was I who destroyed the Amorite before them,
whose height was like the height of the cedars
and who was as strong as the oaks;
Also it was I who brought you up out of the land of Egypt
and led you forty years in the wilderness,
to possess the land of the Amorite.
And I raised up some of your sons for prophets,
and some of your young men for
Is it not indeed so, O people of Israel?
Behold, I will press you down in your place,
as a cart full of sheaves presses down.
Flight shall perish from the swift,
and the strong shall not retain his strength,
nor shall the mighty save his life;
he who handles the bow shall not stand,
swift of foot shall not save himself,
nor shall he who rides the horse save his life;
and he who is stout of heart among the mighty
shall flee away naked in that day,
has spoken against you, O people of Israel, against the whole family that I brought up out of the land of Egypt:
of all the families of the earth;
unless they have agreed to meet?
Does a lion roar in the forest,
Does a young lion cry out from his den,
Does a bird fall in a snare on the earth,
when there is no trap for it?
Does a snare spring up from the ground,
Is a trumpet blown in a city,
and the people are not afraid?
Does disaster come to a city,
and to the strongholds in the land of Egypt,
and see the great tumults within her,
They do not know how to do right,
those who store up violence and robbery in their strongholds.
An adversary shall surround the land
As the shepherd rescues from the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear,
so shall the people of Israel
who dwell in Samaria be rescued, with the corner of a couch and part
and testify against the house of Jacob,
that on the day I punish Israel for his transgressions,
I will punish the altars of Bethel,
the horns of the altar shall be cut off
the houses of ivory shall perish,
that, behold, the days are coming upon you,
when they shall take you away with hooks,
even the last of you with fishhooks.
And you shall go out through the breaches,
and you shall be cast out into Harmon,
offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving of
for so you love to do, O people of Israel!
I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities,
lack of bread in all your places,
yet you did not return to me,
when there were yet three months to the harvest;
I would send rain on one city,
and send no rain on another city;
and the field on which it did not rain would wither;
to drink water, and would not be satisfied;
yet you did not return to me,
I struck you with blight and mildew;
your many gardens and your vineyards,
your fig trees and your olive trees
yet you did not return to me,
I sent among you a pestilence
I killed your young men with the sword,
I made the stench of your camp go up into your nostrils;
yet you did not return to me,
as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah,
yet you did not return to me,
Therefore thus I will do to you, O Israel;
because I will do this to you,
prepare to meet your God, O Israel!
he who forms the mountains and creates the wind,
declares to man what is his thought,
treads on the heights of the earth—
, the God of hosts, is his name!

I will pass through your midst,
Why would you have the day of the
It is darkness, and not light,
as if a man fled from a lion,
or went into the house and leaned his hand against the wall,
Is not the day of the
and gloom with no brightness in it?
I hate, I despise your feasts,
and I take no delight in your solemn assemblies.
Even though you offer me your burnt offerings and grain offerings,
and the peace offerings of your fattened animals,
I will not look upon them.
Take away from me the noise of your songs;
the melody of your harps I will not listen.
But let justice roll down like waters,
and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.

verse.#text: Did you bring to me sacrifices and offerings during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

#text: shall take up Sikkuth your king, and Kiyyun your star-god—your images that you made for yourselves,
and I will send you into exile beyond Damascus,

chapter.heading: Woe to Those at Ease in Zion

#text: Woe to those who are at ease in Zion,
and to those who feel secure on
to whom the house of Israel comes!
Are you better than these kingdoms?
Or is their territory greater than your territory,
O you who put far away the day of disaster
and bring near the seat of violence?
and stretch themselves out on their couches,
and eat lambs from the flock
and calves from the midst of the stall,
who sing idle songs to the sound of the harp
invent for themselves instruments of music,
anoint themselves with the finest oils,
but are not grieved over the ruin of Joseph!
Therefore they shall now be the first of those who go into exile,
and the revelry of those who stretch themselves out shall pass away.
has sworn by himself, declares the
and I will deliver up the city and all that is in it.
if ten men remain in one house, they shall die.
the one who anoints him for burial, shall take him up to bring the bones out of the house, and shall say to him who is in the innermost parts of the house,
Is there still anyone with you?
Silence! We must not mention the name of the
the great house shall be struck down into fragments,
and the little house into bits.
But you have turned justice into
and the fruit of righteousness into wormwood
Have we not by our own strength
I will raise up against you a nation,
and they shall oppress you from
he was forming locusts when the latter growth was just beginning to sprout, and behold, it was the latter growth after the king's mowings.
When they had finished eating the grass of the land, I said,
for a judgment by fire, and it devoured the great deep and was eating up the land.

Go, prophesy to my people Israel.

Your wife shall be a prostitute in the city,
and your sons and your daughters shall fall by the sword,
shall be divided up with a measuring line;
you yourself shall die in an unclean land,
Israel shall surely go into exile away from its land.

chapter.heading: The Coming Day of Bitter Mourning

#text: showed me: behold, a basket of summer fruit.
has come upon my people Israel;
I will never again pass by them.
you who trample on the needy
and bring the poor of the land to an end,
that we may offer wheat for sale,
the ephah small and the shekel
and deal deceitfully with false balances,
that we may buy the poor for
and the needy for a pair of sandals
and sell the chaff of the wheat?
I will never forget any of their deeds.
Shall not the land tremble on this account,
and everyone mourn who dwells in it,
and all of it rise like the Nile,
and sink again, like the Nile of Egypt?
I will make the sun go down at noon
and darken the earth in broad daylight.
I will turn your feasts into mourning
and all your songs into lamentation;
I will bring sackcloth on every waist
I will make it like the mourning for an only son
and the end of it like a bitter day.
I will send a famine on the land—
not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water,
but of hearing the words of the
They shall wander from sea to sea,
they shall run to and fro, to seek the word of the
but they shall not find it.
In that day the lovely virgins and the young men
As your god lives, O Dan,
they shall fall, and never rise again.
I saw the Lord standing beside
and shatter them on the heads of all the people;
and those who are left of them I will kill with the sword;
not one of them shall flee away;
not one of them shall escape.
from there shall my hand take them;
if they climb up to heaven,
from there I will bring them down.
from there I will search them out and take them;
and if they hide from my sight at the bottom of the sea,
there I will command the serpent, and it shall bite them.
And if they go into captivity before their enemies,
there I will command the sword, and it shall kill them;
and I will fix my eyes upon them
for evil and not for good.
he who touches the earth and
and all who dwell in it mourn,
and all of it rises like the Nile,
and sinks again, like the Nile of Egypt;
who builds his upper chambers in the heavens
and founds his vault upon the earth;
who calls for the waters of the sea
and pours them out upon the surface of the earth—
Did I not bring up Israel from the land of Egypt,
and I will destroy it from the surface of the ground,
except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,
and shake the house of Israel among all the nations
as one shakes with a sieve,
but no pebble shall fall to the earth.
All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword,
Disaster shall not overtake or meet us.
the booth of David that is fallen
and rebuild it as in the days of old,
that they may possess the remnant of Edom
all the nations who are called by my name,
when the plowman shall overtake the reaper
and the treader of grapes him who sows the seed;
the mountains shall drip sweet wine,
and all the hills shall flow with it.
I will restore the fortunes of my people Israel,
they shall rebuild the ruined cities and inhabit them;
they shall plant vineyards and drink their wine,
and they shall make gardens and eat their fruit.
I will plant them on their land,
and they shall never again be uprooted
